relation: Configures an MVR group on the router.
Configures the maximum number of MVR groups on the router.
Configures the VLAN in which multicast data is received.
Configures a switch port as an MVR receiver or source port.
Enables the immediate leave feature of MVR on the port.
Displays the details of all MVR member interfaces or a single requested MVR member interface.
Displays the details of all MVR members and number of MVR members in all active MVR groups on a particular VLAN or port.
Displays all receiver ports that are members of an IP multicast group or those on the specified interface port.
Displays all source ports that are members of an IP multicast group or those on the specified interface port.
Clears the join counters of all the MVR ports, source ports, receiver ports, or of a specified MVR interface port.
pageTitle: Cisco IOS LAN Switching Command Reference - mac address-group through revision [Support] - Cisco
TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {1599=This command was introduced on the Cisco 12000 series Internet router.}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {81125=(Optional) Specifies the maximum number of MAC entries per-VLAN per-Encoded Address Recognition Logic (EARL) allowed; valid values are from 5 to 32768 MAC-address entries., 132324=Cisco 860 Series ISRs, Cisco 880 Series ISRs, Cisco 2600 Series, Cisco 3600 Series, and Cisco 3700 Series Routers, 502137=Specifies the MVR multicast VLAN ID. All source ports must belong to this VLAN. The VLAN range is from 1 to 1001 and from 1006 to 4094., 605488=Sets the time interval in seconds by which load sharing will be deferred on the switch. Valid range is from 1 to 1800 seconds. The default deferal interval is 120 seconds, 468689=The default number of MVR groups is 1000., 630741=You cannot configure VLAN 1 or VLANs 1001 to 1005 as PVLANs., 358440=This command was implemented on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, and Cisco 3700 series routers., 56737=Cisco 2600 Series, Cisco 3600 Series, and Cisco 3700 Series Routers, 51218=Cisco 2600 Series, Cisco 3600 Series, and Cisco 3700 Series Routers, 43028=This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.2(8)T on Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, and Cisco 3700 series routers., 675055=This command was implemented on the Cisco ASR 1000 Series Aggregation Services Router., 42683=This command was introduced on Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, and Cisco 3700 series routers., 349019=Number of the SPAN session. For Cisco 2600, 3600, and 3700 series routers, valid values are 1 and 2., 723229=ID of the REP segment. The range is from 1 to 1024., 732499=The segment for which REP will be enabled. Assign a segment ID to the interface. The range is from 1 to 1024., 114015=The MAC-move counter notification generates a syslog message when the number of MAC moves in a VLAN exceeds the maximum limit. The maximum limit is 1000 MAC moves., 391236=The filter keyword is not supported on the Cisco 2600 series or the Cisco 3600 series routers., 46009=Cisco 2600 Series, Cisco 3600 Series, and Cisco 3700 Series Routers, 750536=Identify one REP segment or a list of segments to receive STCNs. The range is 1 to 1024. You can also configure a sequence of segments (for example 3-5, 77, 100)., 189639=Specifies one or more IP ACLs for a VLAN access-map sequence. The range is from 1 to 199 and from 1300 to 2699., 289211=ip-subnet-addr --Short subnet address format. The trailing decimal number 00 in an IP address YY.YY.YY.00 specifies the boundary for an IP-subnet address. For example, 172.22.36.00 indicates a 24-bit subnet address (subnet mask 172.22.36.00/255.255.255.0), and 172.24.00.00 indicates a 16-bit subnet address (subnet mask 172.24.00.00/255.255.0.0). However, this format can identify only a subnet address of 8, 16, or 24 bits., 39530=(Optional) Specifies the VLAN to which the changed aging time should be applied. Valid values are from 2 to 1001., 358792=This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.2(8)T on the Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, and Cisco 3700 series routers., 609098=The valid range of seconds is 1 to 1800 seconds; the default is 120 seconds., 645580=VLAN 1 or VLANs ranging from 1002 to 1005 cannot be configured as PVLANs. Extended VLANs (VLAN IDs 1006 to 4094) can belong to PVLANs., 145990=(Optional) Specifies the data-link connection identifier (DLCI) to be mapped to this MAC address. Valid values are from 16 to 1007., 62729=This command was integrated into Cisco IOS Release 12.2(8)T, on Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, and Cisco 3700 series routers., 62383=This command was implemented on Cisco 2600 series, Cisco 3600 series, and Cisco 3700 series routers., 618014=The load share deferral interval is determined by a single global timer configurable from 1 to 1800 seconds by the port-channelload-defer command. The default interval is 120 seconds. After an SSO switchover, a period of several seconds to several minutes can be required for the reinitialization of line cards and the reestablishment of forwarding tables, particularly multicast topologies.}
textBeforeTable: Syntax Description in access-list-number access-group mac no in access-list-number access-group mac To use a MAC access control list (ACL) to control the reception of incoming traffic on a Gigabit Ethernet interface, an 802.1Q VLAN subinterface, an 802.1Q-in-Q stacked VLAN subinterface, use the macaccess-groupcommand in interface or subinterface configuration mode. To remove a MAC ACL, use the no form of this command. mac access-group revision rep stcn rep segment rep preempt segment rep preempt delay rep lsl-retries rep lsl-ageout timer rep block port rep admin vlan private-vlan synchronize private-vlan mapping private-vlan association private-vlan port-channel port load-defer port-channel load-defer platform port-channel local-significance pagp timer pagp rate pagp port-priority platform vfi provision vlan pagp learn-method name (MST) mvrp vlan creation mvrp timer mvrp registration mvrp mac-learning mvrp global mvr vlan mvr type mvr querytime mvr max-groups
textAfterTable: Note The macaccess-groupcommand is supported on a VLAN subinterface only if a VLAN is already configured on the subinterface. Examples The following example applies MAC ACL 101 on incoming traffic received on Gigabit Ethernet interface 0:  Router> enable Router# configure terminal Router(config)# interface gigabitethernet 0 Router(config-if)# mac access-group 101 in Related Commands Command Description access-list (MAC) Defines a MAC ACL. clear mac access-list counters Clears the counters of a MAC ACL. ip access-group Configures an IP access list to be used for packets transmitted from the asynchronous host.
